tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
The experience was satisfactory. But I have a complaint. I had not realised it at that time but after I came back home I realised it and it was a bit too late by then... 
The consultation charges were rs 700
The X -ray was for rs 400
And the plaster treatment was for rs 2500. As mentioned in the bill ( which the receptionist did not give me). 
The total amount sums up to rs 3200. But I was charged rs 3600. The bill was even made for rs 3200 but you may check the transaction done, it was for 3600. 
This is not morally correct. Not happy with this. 
Sorry to say...

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I visited the doctor for treatment for my mother the doctor suggested x rays to be done from the clinic itself. I told the doctor that we have an echs card and we will get x rays done from outside. the tone of the doctor suddenly became rude and he didn't explain anything when I took the x rays to the doctor. he is a rude *** * **** ****** *******

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I was experiencing knee pain, and i found out Dr. Mohanta was highly recommended. So i went there and told him about my pain. First of all he didn't  explain anything about the issue and just said take these medicines and apply ice pack and one oil and meet me after 10 weeks. I did all these things for 10 weeks religiously but couldn't get relief so I went there again. This time he told me get an Xray, i got it done right away and then again instead of explaning anything he just told me to go to physiotherapist. Totally unsatisfactory services.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: My daughter had a knock knee issue and her vitamin d and c were really gone down and was having trouble walking and going up stairs. I started searching through Practo the best Doctor for her treatment to quickly fix the issue. I came to know about Dr. S Mahanta and i am really happy that my daughter gone well and issue is getting resolved quicker then i thought. Doctor is very professional and so quick to give solution with great medicine and I really thank you Sir as like all says that Doctors save many lives and sent by God

reply_text: I don’t think I deserve such bad words. I examine each and every patient properly to come to a diagnosis and advise only the relevant investigations. review: We are happy with the check-up process of Doctor Mahanta. The doctor is friendly by nature and listens to the patient's problem in detail. He has given a detailed description of the Do's and Dont's. He also suggested an immediate x-ray based on which further investigations were done. The clinic is well equipped with facilities like Physiotherapist, x-ray facility, lab tests and even medicines which are available at the counter. The guys at the reception are good at their job.

review: He put a big 2 feet plaster to treat a minor fracture on my toe  Anyone who looked at really got frightened. *** **** **** ** **** ***** ******  Finally,  I took a second advise ** * ******* ******** ***** **** **** *** *** ******* ************
reply_text: Hi Gud evening. The best treatment for a toe fracture is a plaster for 3 to 4 weeks. Otherwise there tend to be some persistent pain and some displacement of the fracture. Even for soft tissue injury when there is no fracture we put plaster for 10 to 14 days. Regarding the length lower limb plasters are either below knee or above knee. Regarding the removal treatment protocols differ from doctor to doctor and putting a plaster always does good rather than harm to a patient.
